parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "job_name": "gpus",
    "output_file": "/ukp-storage-1/zhang/slurm_logs/gpu-a180-%j.out",
    "mail_user": "hao.zhang@stud.tu-darmstadt.de",
    "mail_type": "ALL",
    "partition": "yolo",
    "qos": "yolo",
    "ntasks": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 2,
    "mem": "32GB",
    "gres": "gpu:1",
    "constraint": "gpu_model:a180",
    "conda_env": "/mnt/beegfs/work/zhang/conda/dragon",
    "cuda_version": "11.0"
  }
}
```

This script is running under the **SLURM** workload manager. It defines several parameters for the job, including:

* **Job name:** "gpus"
* **Output file:** "/ukp-storage-1/zhang/slurm_logs/gpu-a180-%j.out"
* **Mail user:** "hao.zhang@stud.tu-darmstadt.de"
* **Mail type:** "ALL" (send all notifications)
* **Partition:** "yolo"
* **Quality of Service:** "yolo"
* **Number of tasks:** 1 (for parallel jobs)
* **CPUs per task:** 2
* **Memory:** 32GB
* **GPU resources:** 1 GPU of model "a180"

The script also activates a conda environment ("/mnt/beegfs/work/zhang/conda/dragon") and loads a specific CUDA version ("11.0") using the module system. Finally, it runs `nvidia-smi` to display information about the GPU.
